metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9441 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Tatsuya Kinoshita w3m fork before 0.5.3-31.w3m allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentationfault and crash) via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9441` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

w3m - 0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1
w3m-img - 0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: w3m package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1').
